meanings.definition: The scientific description of the customs of individual peoples and cultures.
meanings.sent1: In his ethnography, the researcher carefully documented the traditions of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in ethnography to learn about different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The ethnography of the village customs made for an interesting read.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed ethnography painted a vivid picture of the community's way of life.
meanings.sent5: The ethnography brought to life the unique practices of the ancient civilization.

meanings.definition: The study and systematic recording of human cultures.
meanings.sent1: The ethnography of the indigenous group provided valuable insights into their way of life.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used ethnography to understand the cultural practices of the society.
meanings.sent3: The humorous side of ethnography was evident in the quirky traditions observed.
meanings.sent4: His ethnography of the city's neighborhoods revealed a rich tapestry of diversity.
meanings.sent5: Through ethnography, we can delve into the intricacies of different cultural norms.
